Job_Description:
We are looking for a Full Stack .NET Web Developer who is hands on and passionate about building engaging websites and applications, enjoys working with the creative team to create rich user experiences, and has the attention to detail to bring creative ideas to life. While primarily focused on the back end, integration and understanding of the front end is crucial to the position.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The essential duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
· Possess an in-depth understanding of object-oriented C# ASP.NET development--preferably using ASP.NET Core Razor Pages.
· Possess a solid depth in Database Development to ensure data integrity with ease of maintainability.
· Have experience developing web applications using MS SQL Server (Working knowledge of MySQL, etc.).
· Have experience utilizing Git.
· Possess the skills and patience to deliver a rich user experience using HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript.
· Have experience with JavaScript that extends beyond utilizing publicly available plugins. (Node.JS (server/client/utility), KnockoutJS, jQuery)
· Have the ability to create and integrate with APIs.
· Have experience with Cloud technologies such as Azure, AWS or others.
· Have an understanding of network and application security.
· Be able to create a whole application including database and front-end and deploy into production
· Have the ability to support legacy codebase: Classic ASP, ASP.NET Forms VB, understand and maintain existing applications.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
· High school diploma or equivalent minimum.
· BS/BA in IT or relevant discipline will be considered an advantage.
· Have at least five years of software development experience focused on public-facing website development.
· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
· Ability to maintain confidentiality is a must.
· Be comfortable in an agile development environment.
· Be a driven, positive, self-starter with the ability to thrive and deliver in a fast-paced, innovative and creative environment.

JOB SUMMARY:

Collects and documents requirements. Writes design specifications for portions of PharmASSIST product. Designs are written using established templates, formats and notation. Implements designs and performs follow up as needed.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

50% Develops and maintains software for internal and external customers. All software will be written in accordance with established standards and conventions. This will include, development of software requirements, creation of design approach, coding of application software and creation/execution of unit test plan.

30% Finds, recreates and proposes solutions for anomalies in the operation of deliverable and internal software systems. Documents, tracks and analyzes these anomalies for use in quality analysis.

10% Creates and collects metric data that will help monitor stability and effectiveness of software systems. Helps to minimize cost of software development through the use of automated tools and by providing suggestions on procedural changes.

5% Follows and provides feed back on procedures used within the Software Development and other Internal Organizations (e.g. Customer Service, Manufacturing, etc.) related to software development, problem resolution, system setup or any other process that involves software. Includes developing a thorough understanding of all existing software related processes and procedures.

5% Interacts with Hardware Engineering, Marketing, Customer Service and directly with customers to provide information on system capabilities and to collect requirements for system modifications and enhancements.

5% Reviews and provides updates for the documentation for internal and external software products.

5% Supports, and maintains a fundamental understanding of, other organizations in capacities that may extend outside of the area of software development and provides support as required.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:

Required:
1-2 years’ experience using event focused programming in user interface and database development.
1-2 years’ experience using relational databases and SQL.
Ability to adapt quickly to changing requirements and short schedules.
5+ years’ experience with Microsoft operating systems and Office tools.
Excellent written and communication skills.
Demonstrates an understanding of software product lifecycles.
Demonstrates ownership for assigned tasks.

Recommended:
Experience with Visual Basic 6 and Visual Basic .NET.
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server.
Experience with Microsoft

Spok has a passion for healthcare and a commitment to our core values of communications, innovation, accountability, and putting the customer first. Watch this video: Improving Clinical Workflow Through Accurate and Efficient Communications and learn how we’re living our company values every day and changing the way healthcare communicates. We’re coders, problem solvers, and learners who are helping caregivers act faster, heal bodies and save lives. Spok has an opening for a Managing Director of Education Services who will build and lead the customer-facing training organization. This role presents a unique opportunity for a proven education services leader to take our product training to the next level. In this role, you will use previous experience managing a P&L-based education organization to develop and execute an education services strategy. The education leader must be well-versed in the principles of XaaS business models and how to align training to help drive product adoption and customer retention.
Position Summary:
The Managing Director of Education Services (MDEC) is responsible and accountable for successfully developing and implementing the vision, mission, profitability, and both short and long-term objectives for the Education and Services Line of Business. In this position, the Managing Director of Education Services will lead and manage the instructional design/curriculum team, the instructor delivery team and the education operations function. We need an individual who thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment to define a customer facing content strategy and to deliver impactful business results and achieve revenue objectives through the design, development, delivery and evaluation of the training content and materials. You will play a vital, strategic role in ensuring that the company has the learning programs and content needed to enable the sale, adoption, expansion and renewal of Spok’s products. You are the owner of the customer experience as it relates to Education services. This role is a leader in operational and training excellence including metric identification and oversight of all projects to ensure overall quality; identifying, evaluating, and developing methods and procedures that are efficient, effective, and meet best practice standards. This leader will need to be passionate about change, improvement and transformation for our employees and for customers, ready to jump in at any time as an active executive no matter the time of day.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Develop and lead the vision for the Education Services Practice.
Responsible for developing and executing the business model for the attainment of revenue and P&L goals for the Education Services Practice; manage an education organization that evolves from break-even to a revenue generating organization that produces margin and meets profit objectives.
Identify and develop routes to market for education offers.
Develop and deploy easy buy/easy sell mechanisms, such as learning subscription plans, training credits, training days, etc.
Define and develop the content strategy and processes that will be used to ensure rapid, flexible development and timely maintenance of technical training materials and programs for product users.
Lead the content development team in needs analysis and assist in the prioritization of projects. Oversee the design and development of curriculum, content, lab work, certifications, and all related training material.
Assess and identify technology to enable completion of lab work, both in a classroom, remotely and online. Assess and identify technology to provide online learning via a digital platform that enables learner collaboration through the platform.
Manage a team of instructors who will deliver public classroom, virtual instructor-led and onsite training.
Create and execute a comprehensive training strategy designed to maximize client adoption, increase application stickiness, drive revenue growth, and build expertise
Design a blended learning environment including: e-learning; virtual instructor-led training and public classroom/onsite -training, etc.
Identify the tools and learning technology choices that will provide ways to cost effectively scale programs and improve learning effectiveness and speed to proficiency for trainees.
Partner effectively with the sales, customer success, support, and any other organizations to effectively land training in customer accounts.
Collect and analyze training data to demonstrate the correlation of training to product adoption and retention. Effectively use dashboards to communicate critical metrics and results, monthly and quarterly.
Create and manage the communication strategy for promoting and highlighting Product Learning Services strategy, priorities, and status.
You will play a primary role in finding, vetting, procuring, and deploying a formal Learning Management System as approved by internal executive stakeholders.
Lead your team to manage multiple projects and programs concurrently.
Provide guidance and support for customer escalations, satisfaction and value attainment. Travel to customer sites as necessary.
Supervisory Responsibilities:
May directly supervises up to 5 non-supervisory employees; as the program grows, may manage one to two subordinate supervisors who supervise a total of 5-10 employees. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university; and 10+ years’ of directly related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of Education and experience to include managing a profit and loss.
Preferred Skills and Qualifications:
10+ years of experience in revenue-generating Education services with P&L responsibility
At least 2 years’ experience at a company with a XaaS business model either fully, or in part, and can apply XaaS principles to a customer-facing training organization.
8+ years of professional services or project management experience
6+ years leadership experience managing training teams (with direct reports), including international teams to design and develop training programs and curriculum materials for a SaaS company, preferably in Healthcare.
Can apply data collection methodologies and convert general data and findings into specific, actionable recommendations and is experienced with developing and using dashboards to visualize the education services business.
Has a solid understanding of the usage of technology in learning, including but not limited to remote virtual delivery, virtual hands-on lab environments, application of social platforms to drive customer engagement, video in online learning, badging, etc.
Ability to establish strategy and drive execution with tangible results
An undergraduate degree in either a management, technical, communication, Education or related field; Master’s degree preferred.
Technical knowledge in cloud software, API/webservice integration, and VoIP/networks a plus. Cloud based software training and onboarding experience preferred.
Successful track record in Education and adoption strategy, operations and go-to-market for all digital training courses, subscriptions, video-based offerings and custom courses.
Experience developing and growing a successful Education services practice or line of business in an enterprise software development organization
Knowledge of and experience with adult education principles, agile methods, learning technology and program management skills together in the design, development and maintenance of Education solutions as well as assessments, certification or accreditation programs
Experience developing blended Education models to match the appropriate methods with the subject matter. Includes experience designing and developing stand alone, self-directed e-learning modules.
Experience working with industry standard Education Management Systems (LMS) and reporting and measuring training results and Education effectiveness.
Experience managing the review and quality assurance processes for training content and materials.
Experience integrating the use of knowledge bases and online reference for Education and performance support
Experience with LMS’s, SCORM and XAPI, and familiarity with online learning technology and virtual delivery technology ideal. Experience analyzing and presenting detailed metrics using tools like Excel, Tableau, SharePoint, LMS or data warehouses and experience using one or more tools like Articulate Storyline, Adobe Captivate, Camtasia, Go Animate, video/audio production or similar.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively with Customers/Users, Leaders and team members in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrated understanding of impact of current, new, and proposed product features
Understanding of new system implementation and installation processes
Ability to identify key issues through accurate problem triage
Knowledge of Microsoft Product Suite including Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, SharePoint and Skype; Internet software; e-learning software such as Articulate Storyline, Adobe Captivate, Camtasia, Go Animate; Education Management Systems, SCORM, XAPI, Web Meeting
Ability to travel to visit customer sites or attend conferences (approximately 20% travel).

Job_Title: Trust Officer - must reside in South Dakota
Job_Description:
Why work with us here at Slavic401k? We are truly an innovator in the retirement plan industry and have found true success in leveraging our technology platforms to differentiate us from our competitors. We're grateful to say that business is booming amidst the chaos of Covid-19. We're on track to experience a 25% growth rate this year and this role would be an opportunity to partner with the best in the business to help us to align a new business model (Trust business) to continue expanding our business model.
We value our culture and take care of our employees. This role comes with a 30% performance bonus (based on company health and individual goal completion), paid out annually. To name a few benefits, we offer tuition assistance, professional development and flexible schedules to offer a healthy work-life balance and set you on your course to continued growth.
POSITION SUMMARY: The Trust Officer will oversee the alignment with Slavic Trust and all entities of Slavic Inc. through effective partnership with senior leadership and the Board of Directors by assisting in laying the framework for the newly established business through implementation of policies and procedures in strategic alignment with business goals.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
· Develops, implements and administers all aspects of the Bank’s Trust Program; assists independent, state and federal regulator auditor inquiries; reviews and writes compliance related policies and procedures; makes recommendations to the Board of Directors and Senior Management when appropriate; submits annual reports to the Board of Directors detailing trust issues.
· Maintains a proficient knowledge of all Trust rules and regulations.
· Performs duties to ensure the safety and security of all customer information; restricts access to customer information only to personnel with a legitimate need for such information, both inside and outside the Bank.
· Works closely with the Board of Directors and senior leadership to develop strategic plans, reviews reports; organizes plans and makes recommendations for major Trust initiatives involving functional changes within the Bank and budgets. Identifies and mitigates potential risk issues against the Bank; interacts with Bank personnel pertaining to such issues.
· Oversees actions of comprehensive self-testing, independent third party and regulatory audits; makes necessary preparations for such audits or exams; coordinates responses to external auditors and regulatory examiners; ensures deficiencies identified from such audits and examinations are corrected.
· Ensures compliance with all applicable reporting and recordkeeping requirements.
· Consistently applies superior decision making techniques pertaining to inquiries, approvals and requests as they apply to existing policies and procedures, keeping within assigned approval limits and using these instances as learning tools for employee development.
· Assumes responsibility for special projects gathers data and prepares reports for Senior Management, audits and other personnel.
· Processes, solves and answers complex customer transactions, problems or inquiries.
· Demonstrates highly developed sales, client contact, and relationship management skills including the development of targeted business plans.
· Treats people with respect; keeps commitments; inspires the trust of others; works ethically and with integrity; upholds organizational values; accepts responsibility for own actions.
· As a primary fiduciary contact resolves problems for client issues. Challenges and collaborates with the client to articulate and achieve goals. Utilizes and ensures prospect/client information is appropriately entered, updated, and managed and updates in Customer and Prospect tracking system for mailings. Completes annual administrative reviews. Ensures compliance and proper documentation requirements for fulfilling internal fiduciary policies and procedures regarding business acceptance, discretionary actions, and all other bank policies and guidelines. Works closely with trust assistant to ensure proper tax reporting.
· Shows respect and sensitivity for cultural differences; educates others on the value of diversity; promotes working environment free of harassment of any type; builds a diverse workforce and supports affirmative action.
· Follows policies and procedures; completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; supports the Bank’s goals and values; benefits the bank through outside activities.
· Performs the position safely, without endangering the health or safety to themselves or others and will be expected to report potentially unsafe conditions. The employee shall comply with occupational safety and health standards and all rules, regulations and orders issued pursuant to the OSHA Act of 1970, which are applicable to one’s own actions and conduct.
· Other duties as assigned.
DESIRED CANDIDATE
· Strong knowledge of personal trust, investment and wealth management.
· Attorney, JD, CTFA, CFA, CFP or other professional designations a plus
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
· Bachelor’s degree from a four year college or university; 5 - 7 years of experience and/or training; or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Work related experience should consist of an in-depth background in Bank administration, compliance and supervisory skills. Educational experience, through in-house training sessions, formal school or financial industry related curriculum, should be applicable to the financial industry.
· South Dakota residency, required
· Experience working with custodial institutions
· Advanced knowledge of Bank administration, lending and operations products and services; related state and federal laws and regulations, and other Bank operational policies and procedures.
· Intermediate experience, knowledge and training in all operational and lending activities and terminology.
· Proven ability to effectively train and instruct others in a formal classroom or one-on-one environment.
· Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, and technical procedures.
· Advanced knowledge of preventive and reactive security measures (e.g., robbery, bomb threats, extortion, kidnapping, training, etc.) and systems (e.g., alarms, motion detectors, etc.); experience in dealing with various law enforcement agencies.
· Advanced knowledge of preventative and reactive safety measures (e.g., accidents, site inspections, training, etc.) and systems (e.g., fire alarms, extinguishers, protective apparel, etc.); experience in dealing with various state safety agencies and other personnel.
· Excellent organizational and time management skills.
· Advanced skills in computer terminal and personal computer operation; mainframe computer system; word processing and spreadsheet software programs.
· Exceptional verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to apply common sense to carry out instructions and instruct others, train personnel, write reports, correspondence and procedures, and speak clearly to customers and employees.
· Ability to deal with complex problems involving multiple facets and variables in non-standardized situations.
· Ability to work with no supervision while performing duties.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS Sitting, standing and walking and occasionally lifting 10-25 pounds.
WORK ENVIRONMENT – Modern office suite in office building located in South Dakota.

Job_Title: Shipping Technician - Pressure Sensitive (3rd shift) - De Pere, WI
Job_Description:
Do you enjoy working hands-on utilizing some of the best technology in the printing and packaging industry? Does accepting daily challenges and exceeding goals resonate with you? Belmark is currently seeking a Shipping Technician to run our world class equipment to help produce and ship a high quality product in a timely fashion for our customers. With a focus on innovation and customer satisfaction, our technicians are able to work in a friendly environment with a potential to grow with the company. 3rd shift work hours are from 6:00 p.m. - 6:00 a.m. on Sunday and 12:00 a.m. - 6:00 a.m., Monday - Thursday. Employees on this shift work 36 hours and are paid for 40 hours.
Belmark creates many of the labels, cartons, and flexible film we as consumers see daily when shopping for various items. Our primary markets are in the food and beverage industry. A nationally recognized company; our customers vary from small to large companies, and customer satisfaction is our primary goal. By following our company mission of speed-to-market, product development, service development and quality, we have created a company dedicated to our customers, and created a culture that values each of our employees.
Position Overview
Responsible for packaging, labeling and staging printed products in a timely manner in order to meet customer needs. Must be able to multi-task, have a high level of attention to detail and work in a fast paced environment.
Work in a team environment and communicate effectively with Customer Service and Rewind Departments to meet daily shipment deadlines.
Work with third party logistic software systems to determine the best and most economical shipping method to meet customer needs.
Provide accurate job order data entry and use Federal Express/UPS software systems.
Use an automated stretch wrap machine.
Position Requirements
Requires education equivalent to two (2) years of high school.
Knowledge of and the ability to effectively utilize the English language.
Regular attendance is required. May be required to work some overtime.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide whole numbers, decimals and fractions.
Ability to operate a computer and computer systems.
Belmark offers a friendly working environment with a competitive benefits package for eligible employees. Our benefits include:
Health, Dental, & Life Insurance
Flexible Spending Account
401(k) & Profit Sharing Plan
Paid vacation, personal time & holidays
Employee Assistance Program
On-site Health Clinic
On-site Fitness Center

Job Description
Digital Innovation Manager, PIC
Job Description
Genus strives to provide beef, dairy and pork producers with superior breeding stock to enable the production of affordable and nutritious animal protein for consumers. PIC is the swine division with a mission to pioneer animal genetic improvement to help nourish the world.
PIC currently supplies over 70% of the world’s top pork producers. We directly employ people in 18 countries worldwide and our products are available in more than 50 countries across the globe. We are a diverse team, ranging from scientists to sales teams, production personnel to customer service, and are all united by a passion for producing nutritious, affordable pork and a commitment to continuous improvement.
The Digital Innovation Manager will be responsible for advancing PIC’s high-throughput digital phenotyping platform, leveraging camera technology, machine learning techniques and other digital technologies, and transforming the way phenotypic data is collected and utilized within the genetic improvement program.
Core Duties and Responsibilities
 Actively identify disruptive and innovate digital technologies to improve genetic selection processes or customer success.
 Solve challenging problems by utilizing an ecosystem of sensor technology such as video, infrared,
RFID, temperature/RH and others, combined with machine learning algorithms, to measure animal behavior, physiology and health.
 Engage and collaborate with experts across multi-disciplinary fields and organizations to drive innovative technologies.
 Manage immediate need for technology application within the business with long-term digital platform vision.
 Utilize all evolving digital technologies to asses movement, behavior and health in livestock
 Design, organize and execute projects that lead to development of monitoring tools for automatic detection of behavior, phenotypic and performance traits.
 Utilize existing and new RFID technology to improve the efficiency of data recording.
 Effectively communicate the status and results of research projects to stakeholders.
 The successful candidate will collaborate with a team of statisticians skilled in prediction methodologies using AI and machine learning.
 Anticipates internal and or external business challenges; recommends process, product or service improvements
 Communicates complex ideas and influences others to adopt a different point of view
Job Description
Digital Innovation Manager, PIC
Qualifications
 Advanced degree in Applied Electronics, Engineering or related field.
 A minimum of five years of experience in precision agriculture.
 An understanding of statistics, signal processing, time series data, and machine learning.
 Willingness to learn and apply new techniques to capture, transfer, and interpret large commercial datasets.
 Strong analytical skills with the ability to efficiently collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
 Ability to work in and maintain performance expectations in a fast-paced environment

Job_Title: Purina Feed Sales – Dairy – Burnett, WI
Job_Description:
Livestock Production Specialist - Dairy
Position Purpose: The Livestock Production Specialist – Dairy position is responsible to sell feed and all related products in a consultative manner to improve Dairy Producer bottom line performance. The main focus will be working with dairy producers on their lactating cows diets, optimizing milk production efficiency and herd health. This is to be done in a manner that will grow the cooperative/dealer's market share and profitability, improve the cooperative/dealer's efficiency, help achieve the cooperative/dealer's mission and goals, and result in outstanding customer service.
Required (Basic) Experience-Education:
BS in Ag related field or equivalent experience. Candidate should have a good understanding of dairy husbandry, current management practices, and nutritional guidelines.
Competencies-Skills (Required):
Successful candidate should be competent to have basic command of nutritional and management recommendations to livestock owners in the market.
There is a requirement of excellent verbal and written communication skills, focus, along with strong organization and time management skills.
Success in this position requires cold calling, high internal drive, a natural ability for relationship building, and leadership in a team environment.
Computer skills, including in MS Office, necessary for success.
Requires the ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds.
Experience-Education (Preferred):
Preferred candidates will have minimum of 3 years of experience with a Dairy emphasis, proven track record of growing and maintaining a customer base of dairy herds.
Experience as a Dairy herd manager, or related position is favored also.
Competencies-Skills (Preferred):
Experience with ration balancing software, Dairy Comp, PC Dart, etc, with 3 or more years of experience in industry.
Percentage of Travel:
15% over night travel, in addition to daily travel in the assigned geography.
